transcript: Dutton: they want a house for themselves and their family as well and the government just hasn't been building the housing.
Moderator: Jason, you happy with that? And if if you've got a question for the Prime Minister as well?

Jason: I've got a follow-up question just in regards to part of Australia, our way of life is sharing our way of life with the rest of the world. So part of our humanity is doing good. And so us training other people from all around the world gives them an open opportunity to witness our Australianism. And so by not allowing those students to come to Australia, it actually hurts our brand worldwide.
Moderator: We've we've had quite a. America. Thanks Jason.
Moderator: we've had quite a few as you know Mr. Dutton. Foreign students become ministers Prime Ministers. It's it's a good soft power tool, isn't it?
Dutton: look I I think we are not only the best country in the world but I think we've been made better because of our migration story. When you look at the migration.
segment_summary: Dutton speaks on housing issues. Then a Jason from the audience says that not allowing foreign students in the country hurts the brand and international relations with foreign countries. The Moderator and Dutton then respond positively to foreign students.

key_arguments.argument: The government hasn't been building the housing
Not allowing those students to come to Australia, it actually hurts our brand worldwide
Foreign students become ministers Prime Ministers
We've been made better because of our migration story.

rhetorical_analysis.communication_style_notes: Dutton asserts that the government isn't doing enough. Jason is stating how our country can better global presence.

perspective_commentary.conservative: By agreeing to Jason's claims it can further persuade conservative voters into believing the global presence of Australia matters as a country.
perspective_commentary.neutral: The points are well received by everyone involved. Having Jason state that to appeal to both sides of the aisle makes sense from a non-partisan aspect. Stating that international relations are important also builds support from moderates.
perspective_commentary.progressive: Emphasizing it is important for the Australian economy to be involved also appeals to the voter base.

connections_to_previous_segments: This builds upon the housing crisis and then goes directly into international students.
interaction_dynamics: The interaction is a discussion between two people. The Moderator then passes off the question to Dutton for feedback.

notable_quotes.quote: Our way of life is sharing our way of life with the rest of the world.
notable_quotes.speaker: Jason

notable_quotes.quote: Not allowing those students to come to Australia, it actually hurts our brand worldwide.
notable_quotes.speaker: Jason

notable_quotes.quote: We've been made better because of our migration story.
notable_quotes.speaker: Dutton

segment_concise_summary: Discussions on global relations, international students, and building the housing.
